id.description: Sets the id of this node

description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.label: advanced
disabled.description: Whether to disable this REST service from the route during build time. Once an REST service has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

path.description: The path mapping URIs of this REST operation such as /{id}.

to.description: The Camel endpoint this REST service will call, such as a direct endpoint to link to an existing route that handles this REST call.

param.description: Information about parameters for this REST operation

responseMessage.description: Response details for this REST operation

security.description: Security settings for this REST operation

consumes.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input), such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

produces.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output), such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

type.label: advanced
type.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from input to POJO for the incoming data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level. The name of the class of the input data. Append a to the end of the name if you want the input to be an array type.

outType.label: advanced
outType.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from POJO to output for the outgoing data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The name of the class of the input data. Append a to the end of the name if you want the input to be an array type.

bindingMode.description: Sets the binding mode to use. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is off

skipBindingOnErrorCode.label: advanced
skipBindingOnErrorCode.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc, as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

clientRequestValidation.label: advanced
clientRequestValidation.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check: 1) Content-Type header matches what the Rest DSL consumes; returns HTTP Status 415 if validation error. 2) Accept header matches what the Rest DSL produces; returns HTTP Status 406 if validation error. 3) Missing required data (query parameters, HTTP headers, body); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error. 4) Parsing error of the message body (JSon, XML or Auto binding mode must be enabled); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error.

enableCORS.label: advanced
enableCORS.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is false.

enableNoContentResponse.label: advanced
enableNoContentResponse.description: Whether to return HTTP 204 with an empty body when a response contains an empty JSON object or XML root object. The default value is false.

apiDocs.label: advanced
apiDocs.description: Whether to include or exclude this rest operation in API documentation. The default value is true.

deprecated.label: advanced
deprecated.description: Marks this rest operation as deprecated in OpenApi documentation.

streamCache.label: advanced
streamCache.description: Whether stream caching is enabled on this rest operation.

routeId.description: Sets the id of the route
